Class Button

  • java.lang.Object
    • Button
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ToggleButton

    public class Button
extends java.lang.Object
    This Class creates button objects
    Author:
    elan

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.lang.String caption 
      protected double height
      the x, y, height and width are all final private and final as they are never changed the background colour changes and is thus not final the caption is added after the object is created and thus cannot be final (the constructor conplains)
      protected java.lang.String text 
      protected double width
      the x, y, height and width are all final private and final as they are never changed the background colour changes and is thus not final the caption is added after the object is created and thus cannot be final (the constructor conplains)

      the x, y, height and width are all final private and final as they are never changed the background colour changes and is thus not final the caption is added after the object is created and thus cannot be final (the constructor conplains)
      protected double y
      the x, y, height and width are all final private and final as they are never changed the background colour changes and is thus not final the caption is added after the object is created and thus cannot be final (the constructor conplains)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCaption(int caption)
      this will add onto the text already displayed on the button
      void addCaption(java.lang.String caption)
      this will add onto the text already displayed on the button
      void checkMouse()
      checks if the mouse is on the button and highlights it if so
      void clicked()
      decides based on the text that is on the button what it should do if it is clicked
      void isClicked()
      checks if the mouse is pressed while on the button
      void render()
      this will draw the button

    • Constructor Detail

      • Button

        public Button(double x,
      double y,
      double w,
      double h,
      java.lang.String t)
        Constructor for Button
        Parameters:
        x - x co-ordinate where the button will be created
        y - y co-ordinate where the button will be created
        w - the width of the button
        h - the height of the button
        t - the string that will be displayed on the button
